name: Clasping-leaf Pondweed

Identifying Characteristics: Stems: long, branching, rounded in cross-section (1 – 2.5mm in diameter)
Leaves: green, oval to lance-shaped (3-12cm long) with wavy edges, 13-21 veins, alternately arranged, clasp ½ to ¾ around stem with lobed base, fibrous portion of stipules persist
Flowers: midsummer, small, clustered in 4-12 whorls on short spikes (2-4cm); flower stalk longer than spike
Fruits/Seeds: clusters of small disc-like fruits with beak-like protrusions form in spike toward growing tip of plant
Other: There are two pondweed species that share the common name “clasping-leaf pondweed”
Biology: Reproduction by seed when conditions favorable
Range: Native Range: Maine, New England, southeastern and northeastern United States

tags: plants with blade-shaped leaves on stems
